item.title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know - Kevlin Henney (Editor) ⭐️⭐️⭐️
item.description: I like books with these small tips for your daily basis work; you start using it without even realizing it, which is excellent, and this book is one of these. “97 Things Every Programmer Should Know” is a book that each single “Thing” is written by a different author, and these authors are some very well known developers in the industry. These are my favorites notes from this book: Technical debt is like a loan: you benefit from it in the short term, but you have to pay interest on it until it is fully paid.
